data.title: Disappointed and surprised
data.text:
I used to go here every other week 6 years ago for a long time. I haven't been since because of moving. 

The food used to be a 4 out 5 for quality. Today may have been an off day... But it was quite terrible. The tuna roll was warm and so was the California roll. The tuna was gummy. And the wasabi was mushy. I was totally disappointed in the quality and surprised because it used to be good. Unfortunately I will not be returning here again. The customer service was good. If I had dined in, I definitely would've sent back my food, but it was a to-go order. 

The place is small and simple. Definitely not romantic or fancy. But I used to like the small family business with quality that it is lacking today.

data.title: Good Authentic Sushi
data.text: If your looking for authentic, good, fresh, sushi and sashimi this is the place.  Very small and not much on appearance but great taste and a decent price.  The fish is very delicate and tasty.  Not an "amercanized" sushi place.  This is the real deal.

data.title: Bad Service Bad Food Bad Experience
data.text: This restaurant recently changed hands and is now Tokyo Sushi Seoul. I almost left after I sat and looked around. Place was dirty, tables not cleaned, food on the floor and on unclean tables. I got the menu and was confused. Most of the dishes I liked were gone. But  I decided to give it a chance. Unfortunately, I  was not given or asked whether I wanted water or tea. I had to ask. I ordered a Korean dish with noodles and seafood. Nothing special and the squid was overcooked and extremely chewy. Not seasoned properly. I cook Korean food at home and mine is much better. What a disappointment!  This was one of my favorite Japanese restaurants for the last 20 years or so. I won't be coming back again.

data.title: Korean dishes are good
data.text:
My family tried Korean Chinese foods.  They are carefully seasoned and tasted like they are made from scratch.
We have heard that the new chef/owner is the one who worked for Chung Ki Wa in Sterling Heights.

data.title: Good, quick service.
data.text: My husband and I stopped here to grab dinner and we were in and out. The food was good and prices were comparable to most other sushi restaurants.

data.title: Great Little Sushi Restaurant
data.text: This location has gone under a number of changes over the last ten years but the one thing that has stayed consistent is the quality of food, good service, and cleanliness. The sushi here is better than other restaurants in the area. The Shrimp Tempura Roll, Spring Rolls, Takatsu, Miso Soup, and many other items are very good. Always pleasing, I recommend Tokyo Sushi for lunch, dine-in or carry out.

data.title: Good Sushi Joint
data.text:
I like Tokyo Sushi & Grill.  I always get fresh and tasty Sushi.  They have a variety of Sushi boats to choose from.  I usually order a Sushi Boat with a Sushi Roll or a few pieces of Tuna or Eel Sushi.

Definitely worth paying a buck or two more for the high quality Sushi.

Friendly service, clean and comfortable dining area.  Maybe I'll head there today for lunch, just thinking about it!

data.title: great sushi
data.text: This is not a fancy restaurant-kind of a small dive-but you won't be disappointed with the food.  Like most Japanese/sushi spots, they do not have a kid's menu.  We ordered a few items off the sushi menu then some teriyaki and tempura with white rice to share with the kids.  We had plenty of food.  The sushi prices are very reasonable and the quality is good too.  I like their hot tea.  Soft drinks are sold in a can, no refills.   Staff is very professional and accommodating.  Great for take-out too.  They have great lunch specials!

data.title: Best Sushi in Town and Great Service!
data.text: This is my favorite Sushi Bar! Richard the owner always make you feel welcome and the sushi is the freshest in town! He takes pride in serving only the best freshest fish.  I have eaten here for years and it is always my #1 choice when we go out for Sushi.  It is definitely a hidden secret. Also if you don't see it on the sushi menu ask and they will go out of their way to make it for you!

data.title: The best sushi around
data.text: I've tried them all, but nothing beats the food and service you get here~It's always good....never a bad experience. I eat there once a week.

data.title: Tried the rest, they're the best!
data.text: My husband & I got to know Chris when he was a sushi chef for Kyoto, now Benihana, in Troy.  Chris has carried his knowledge and creativity into his own business with his 4 Tokyo Sushi & Grill locations.  The sushi is always fresh and there are more choices of rolls than any place we've ever been to.  The sushi menu is printed on the equivalent of  a standard sheet of print paper, with both sides loaded with sushi/sashimi/nigiri choices.  There are so many of them, that it makes it difficult to decide which delicious experience you want to try.  The salmon nigiri is THE best we've ever eaten with the salmon nearly melting in your mouth.  We've never tried the tempura, sashimi or the many other offerings on the menu, but knowing Chris and his staff, it's got to be exquisite.  Try them, you will NOT be disappointed!

data.title: Best in Metro Detroit
data.text: The original location at Square Lake and Livernois has three siblings now: downtown Birmingham on Maple; across from OU on Squirrel and Walton; and downtown Royal Oak on Center.  They are all superb in taste and value with consistent quality.  Chris, Richard and all the staff are pleasant and very patient while newbies ask questions.  Creativity abounds in the rolls, not only in ingredients but also in name.  Many are named after various things Detroit with automotive and sports team themes.  The sashimi is topnotch.
